Posts.Content: Ooh lordie! I'm having this operation on Monday and have found very little online about it. Please keep us posted on your progress xx
Posts.Title: Lipomodelage

Posts.Content: Hi. Starting my first session next week. 3 FEC followed by 3 T? I think that's right. What do I need to stock up on in terms of entertainment to get me through sessions and food, pain relief and treats between. Any tips gratefully received. Thanks
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: This is going to sound batty.  I've had my first chemo today and am feeling a bit woozy and very slightly sick (taken some kickass drugs). Problem is I don't want to go to bed. I'm tired but worried that I'm going to wake in the night feeling terrible or tomorrow is going to be dreadful. Hoping I sleep and wake up in 5 days time.
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi  When I was having the E of the EC the nurse said that that was the drug that would make my hair fall out. Does that mean it will start growing back when I am having the T sessions? Or am I being overly hopeful!?
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: thanks Lynn.  Feeling certainly no worse than yesterday. Just a bit groggy and sicky but not too bad. It seems at every step that the anticipation is almost the worst part.x
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi. Could you explan PICC line please? Is it something that stays in for the whole four months?
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: thanks Lynn - don't know how I missed that list.  Can't decide on the cold cap. Reading through posts it seems a lot of faff and not guaranteed to work. I might just sit it out.
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Meashmosh. How are you doing? How did the first lot go for you? I had my first EC on Thursday and am still trying to work through what is happening. Feeling a bit sicker today than yesterday but nothing I can't live with. Keep thinking I can smell petrol which isn't helping. How is your hair doing?xxx
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi. No fatigue really in my first cycle. Quite a bit of nausea and feeling sorry for myself but making myself do stuff has helped. Turns out I'm very good at feeling sorry for myself!
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Even though I've read the posts the lack of taste has really taken me by surprise. Have even eaten meat for the first time in years to see if I could taste something. Luckily I passed an old fashioned sweet shop and rediscovered acid drops and fizzy cola bottles. Now I can cope with anything!
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Ah well. A girl can dream of a full head of hair. Not too bad so far but only had one lot. Next one on Thursday and I'm expecting it to be worse. It's a means to an end though isn't it? Did your side effects get worse with each one?
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Sainsburys are good. Primark are okay but didn't retain the pinch for long. The last lot of transfer I had came from stomach and thighs so ended up in TKMaxx buying cycling shorts and running trousers. I only bought ones that claimed to be "compression"
Posts.Title: Can anyone tell me about their experience of lipomodelling please...

Posts.Content: Hi Poppie. I had double mastectomy with expanders but I had to have one removed. I was offered fat transfer. Ive had one op under general anaesthetic day surgery. I will need to have at least a couple more.  The good news is that my stomach hasn't been this flat since the eighties and it was a relatively quick recovery.  The bad news is that I still don't really look like a woman with a pair of boobs. This will be different for you if it's just modelling rather than building. My stomach hurt for a few weeks afterwards but nothing I couldn't manage without paracetamol. Good luck
Posts.Title: Can anyone tell me about their experience of lipomodelling please...

Posts.Content: Hi  Second T this morning which had to be stopped after a few mins. Tight chest, couldn't breathe, face the colour of beetroot. Wonderful chemo nurses all descended on me and felt fine within about 5/10 mins but still very scary. Heard that it's not that uncommon. Meeting Onco next week and hoping to start a new drug but not sure how many/ when I can start it etc. Just when you think the end is in sight....
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11. Me too. You're right that "aggressive" is a terrible word to hear but here is another one - "gamechanger" . That is how my onco has described herceptin.  I'm through chemo and halfway through herceptin. Ten years of tamoxifen. That worried me because I'd heard that some people couldn't do because couldn't stand the side effects but I'm finding it fine.  Getting my life back and you will too. x
